title: Classic Hollywood: Golden Age Movies
description: From Casablanca to Hitchcock thrillers â€” how well do you know Hollywood's Golden Age?

questions.question: In 'Casablanca' (1942), which actor says the famous line, 'Here's looking at you, kid'?
questions.explanation: Humphrey Bogart's Rick Blaine delivered this iconic line to Ingrid Bergman's Ilsa. It's consistently ranked among the greatest movie quotes of all time.

questions.question: Who played Dorothy in 'The Wizard of Oz' (1939)?
questions.explanation: Judy Garland was just 16 when she starred as Dorothy. Her performance of 'Over the Rainbow' became one of the most beloved songs in cinema history.

questions.question: Which Alfred Hitchcock film features a terrifying shower scene with Janet Leigh?
questions.explanation: The shower scene in Psycho (1960) is one of the most famous sequences in film history. It took seven days to shoot the 45-second scene, using 70 camera setups.

questions.question: Which actress starred alongside Cary Grant in 'North by Northwest' (1959)?
questions.explanation: Eva Marie Saint played the mysterious Eve Kendall. The film's crop duster chase and Mount Rushmore climax are among Hitchcock's most thrilling sequences.

questions.question: What 1950 film noir classic features Gloria Swanson as faded silent-film star Norma Desmond?
questions.explanation: In Sunset Boulevard, Norma Desmond's line 'All right, Mr. DeMille, I'm ready for my close-up' became one of the most quoted lines in movie history.

questions.question: Which classic Western starred John Wayne as a cattle driver on the Chisholm Trail?
questions.explanation: Red River (1948) is considered one of the greatest Westerns ever made. It was the first time John Wayne played a morally complex, sometimes villainous character.

questions.question: In 'Singin' in the Rain' (1952), who performs the iconic title number dancing with an umbrella?
questions.explanation: Gene Kelly choreographed and performed the joyful rain dance sequence. He actually filmed it while running a 103-degree fever.

questions.question: Which 1962 epic film starred Peter O'Toole in the title role and won seven Academy Awards?
questions.explanation: Lawrence of Arabia, directed by David Lean, is renowned for its stunning desert cinematography. It was Peter O'Toole's breakout role.

questions.question: Which actress famously stood over a subway grate with her white dress blowing in 'The Seven Year Itch' (1955)?
questions.explanation: Marilyn Monroe's billowing white dress became one of the most iconic images in pop culture history. The actual filming took place on Lexington Avenue in New York City.

questions.question: What was the first feature-length movie to win the Academy Award for Best Picture in color?
questions.explanation: Gone with the Wind (1939) was the first color film to win Best Picture. It won a then-record eight competitive Academy Awards.

questions.question: Which legendary director made 'Rear Window' (1954), starring James Stewart and Grace Kelly?
questions.explanation: Hitchcock filmed the entire movie from the perspective of Stewart's apartment, creating one of cinema's greatest suspense films from a single location.

questions.question: In the 1946 classic 'It's a Wonderful Life,' who played George Bailey?
questions.explanation: James Stewart's portrayal of George Bailey became his personal favorite role. Though the film was initially a box-office disappointment, it later became a beloved holiday classic.

questions.question: Which 1961 film musical, starring Natalie Wood, is a modern retelling of Romeo and Juliet set in New York City?
questions.explanation: West Side Story won ten Academy Awards, including Best Picture. It transplanted Shakespeare's tragedy into the world of rival street gangs in 1950s Manhattan.

questions.question: Which 1944 film noir, directed by Billy Wilder, stars Fred MacMurray and Barbara Stanwyck plotting a murder for insurance money?
questions.explanation: Double Indemnity is considered one of the finest film noirs ever made. The sharp dialogue was co-written by Wilder and crime novelist Raymond Chandler.

questions.question: Which actress starred as Maria von Trapp in 'The Sound of Music' (1965)?
questions.explanation: Julie Andrews brought Maria to life in one of the highest-grossing films of the 1960s. She had already won the Best Actress Oscar the previous year for Mary Poppins.
